intro: Leucopogon melaleucoides, commonly known as the silver-leafed heath, is a shrub native to southeastern Australia. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae, which includes eucalyptus and tea trees. The plant is characterized by its narrow, silver-gray leaves that are covered in fine, white hairs. It produces small, fragrant white or pink flowers during the spring and summer months. This species is adapted to sandy or rocky soils and is often found in heathlands and coastal areas.
